input.description:
String Value - The name of a configuration item defined in a configuration module.
Example: BMC_AR_System

An XML document providing the data template for single or multiple Concept elements.The incident concept is an XML document containing specific elements used to assign multiple values to a single context item. Each value is associated with an element of the Concept.

output.description: An XML document providing detail for one or more incidents
An XML document providing detail for one or more failed incidents
String Value - Count of successful incidents
String Value - Count of failed incidents

String Value - Indicates whether or not the process completed successfully.
Valid values: success, failure
String Value - A process specific string that explains the value of success status.

xslt-stylesheet.stylesheet: <xsl:stylesheet xmlns:xsl="http://www.w3.org/1999/XSL/Transform" version="1.0"> <xsl:output indent="no" /> <xsl:template match="/"> <value> <xsl:choose> <xsl:when test="string-length(.) > '0'"> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">One or more mappings failed</xsl:text> </xsl:when> <xsl:otherwise> <xsl:text disable-output-escaping="no">mapping successfully completed</xsl:text> </xsl:otherwise> </xsl:choose> </value> </xsl:template> </xsl:stylesheet>

output.value: One or more mapping operations failed

input.value: Show contents of failed incident collection

documentation.description: This process will translate input field values to enumerated values using the module configuration mappings.
